docs.snippet: THE Richard Wagner Memorial Association, organized to commemorate the fiftieth anniversary of Wagner's death -- the anniversary proper is Feb. 13, 1933 -- announces that arrangements are being made for performances of most of the operas and...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Richard Wagner Memorial Association, organized to commemorate the fiftieth anniversary of Wagner's death -- the anniversary proper is Feb. 13, 1933 -- announces that arrangements are being made for performances of most of the operas and music-dramas of Wagner at the Mecca Auditorium during January and February, 1933.

headline.main: ACTIVITIES OF MUSICIANS HERE AND AFIELD; Wagner Cycle Planned by Memorial Association -- "The Barber" and "Carmen" in Bryant Park -- Other Items

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 -- Confronted with the refusal of Paraguay to agree to a suspension of hostilities in the Chaco without "adequate guarantees" and of Bolivia to suspend mobilization in the present circumstances, the commission of neutrals, in an...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 -- Confronted with the refusal of Paraguay to agree to a suspension of hostilities in the Chaco without "adequate guarantees" and of Bolivia to suspend mobilization in the present circumstances, the commission of neutrals, in an identic note to both governments, today urged them to suspend hostilities immediately and to agree to a period of three months of negotiation, dating from Oct. 1 at the latest.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 31-- The League of Nations is soon to hear a South American echo of one of Europe's many political problems growing out of the new map that was drawn at Versailles, when a petition is sent to Geneva in the name of 200,000 Croatian...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 31-- The League of Nations is soon to hear a South American echo of one of Europe's many political problems growing out of the new map that was drawn at Versailles, when a petition is sent to Geneva in the name of 200,000 Croatian emigres, identical with a petition being circulated in the United States, asking that Croatia be freed from Serbian rule and restored to independence.
docs.abstract: Petition from 200,000 Croatian emigres in South Amer to be sent to League of Nations, asking that Croatia be restored to independence

headline.main: CROATS FORM PLEA FOR INDEPENDENCE; 200,000 Emigres to Argentina Ask League to Free Race From Serbian Rule. PETITION CIRCULATED HERE King Alexander Is Charged With Reign of Terror and Tyranny Since Versailles Settlement.

byline.original: Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Strength in United States Government bonds and irregular prices for domestic corporation issues and foreign loans characterized dealings in bonds on the Stock Exchange yesterday. The turnover was a little more than the average for the two-hour...
docs.lead_paragraph: Strength in United States Government bonds and irregular prices for domestic corporation issues and foreign loans characterized dealings in bonds on the Stock Exchange yesterday. The turnover was a little more than the average for the two-hour trading period, amounting to $5,170,000.

headline.main: FEDERAL BONDS RISE IN LIMITED TRADING; Domestic Corporation Issues and Foreign Loans End at Irregular Prices. GERMAN GROUP ADVANCES Argentine Obligations Are Lower and Montevideo 6g Higher on the Stock Exchange.

headline.main: BREAK OF ARGENTINA AND URUGUAY ENDED; Healing of Two-Month Rupture Is Expected to Aid Chaco Peace Negotiations.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 13. -- The governments of Argentina, Brazil, Chile and Peru, as neighbors of Bolivia and Paraguay, were invited by the commission of neutrals today to make "constructive suggestions" looking to a cooperative effort to avoid further...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 13. -- The governments of Argentina, Brazil, Chile and Peru, as neighbors of Bolivia and Paraguay, were invited by the commission of neutrals today to make "constructive suggestions" looking to a cooperative effort to avoid further bloodshed in the Chaco and a peaceful solution of that controversy.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
